issue.title: [CF 373] Condition: Absolute Health
issue.body:
Simple request: Could you build a condition option to check for an absolute health (mana) value with <>= operators? That way I could let my rotation-metaicon adapt a new rotation for mobs that won't last long and skip such things as Rend or stacking Sunder Armor. If it's not clear: relative health doesn't work on mobs that only have 1000 life to begin with.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer | Imported from CurseForge issue #373 | Raw

comments.body:
I should probably put these as real conditions. In the mean time, you could use a Lua condition. For example:

``` UnitHeath("target") > 1000 ```

You can also use UnitHealthMax to check the max health of a unit, and you can change the operator and value to whatever you want.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Will do. Though I still need to get my current toon to 85, otherwise I'd have to figure out a new value every other level. I was just asking in advance, in case it took time to implement.

Thanks alot.


> Posted by CurseForge user AmeroGer
